title: Contributing to mapvizieR
text: creating bug report, please check existing issues avoid duplicates. create bug report, include much detail possible: R version package versions (use sessionInfo()) Operating system Minimal reproducible example demonstrating bug Expected behavior vs actual behavior error messages warnings

title: Contributing to mapvizieR
text: Enhancement suggestions tracked GitHub issues. suggesting enhancement: Use clear descriptive title Provide step--step description suggested enhancement Explain enhancement useful Include examples applicable

title: Contributing to mapvizieR
text: Fork repository create branch master Make changes following coding standards Add update tests needed Update documentation ’re changing functionality Run checks devtools::check() submitting Submit pull request clear description changes

title: Contributing to mapvizieR
text: mapvizieR follows tidyverse style guide adaptations: Use snake_case function variable names Use camelCase mapvizieR-specific data column names (matching NWEA conventions) Maximum line length: 120 characters Use #' roxygen2 documentation

title: Contributing to mapvizieR
text: exported functions must roxygen2 documentation Include @param, @return, @examples exported functions Use @inheritParams appropriate reduce duplication

title: Contributing to mapvizieR
text: Write tests new functionality using testthat Place tests tests/testthat/ Name test files test-*.R Aim high test coverage new code

title: Contributing to mapvizieR
text: Use present tense (“Add feature” “Added feature”) Use imperative mood (“Move cursor …” “Moves cursor …”) Reference issues pull requests relevant

title: Contributing to mapvizieR
text: cdf: Comprehensive Data File NWEA MAP roster: Student demographic enrollment data growth_df: Growth data frame term--term growth calculations mapvizieR object: S3 class combining cdf, roster, growth_df

title: mapvizieR Modernization Project
text: document describes comprehensive modernization mapvizieR R package, performed December 25, 2025. goal update package compatibility current R ecosystem, removing deprecated dependencies patterns adding modern infrastructure.

title: mapvizieR Modernization Project
text: mapvizieR R package visualizing analyzing NWEA MAP assessment data. package accumulated technical debt several years, including: Dependency ensurer, archived CRAN Use deprecated ggplot2 parameters (size lines, panel.margin, etc.) Use deprecated dplyr scoped verbs (summarize_(), group_by_(), etc.) Lack modern CI/CD infrastructure visual regression testing plots

title: mapvizieR Modernization Project
text: Created 10 detailed analysis reports examining different aspects codebase: Identified deprecated patterns across 35+ R files Catalogued ggplot2 deprecations (panel.margin, size, aes_string) Catalogued dplyr deprecations (scoped verbs, tbl_df) Documented core data structures (cdf, roster, growth_df, mapvizieR object) Mapped module dependencies Identified ensurer critical blocker (archived CRAN) Noted version requirements ggplot2 dplyr Assessed existing test coverage Identified need visual regression tests Catalogued plot functions Identified deprecated ggplot2 usage patterns Reviewed norm study support Documented data format compatibility Assessed roxygen2 documentation coverage Identified areas needing improvement Designed GitHub Actions workflows Planned pkgdown documentation site Identified potential optimizations Reviewed error message quality Created implementation roadmap Prioritized changes impact risk

text: look source mapvizieR can see workflow. first calls prep_cdf_long raw cdf/AssessmentResults file calls prep_roster roster/StudentsBySchool file roster hand, tags CDF grade levels calling grade_levelify_cdf, triggers series post-processing functions generate labels based grade level season.

title: NY proficiency curves
code: ny <- read.csv(   file = file.path('data-raw', 'ny_linking_curves_tidy.csv'),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE )  peek(ny)  unq_models <- ny[, c('Grade', 'Measurementscale', 'Season')] %>% unique()

what: Iterate and fit a logistic regression to each data set
title: NY proficiency curves
text: Save data package
code: all_preds <- list()  for (i in 1:nrow(unq_models)) {      ids <- unq_models[i, ]      this_raw <- ny[ny$Grade == ids$Grade &         ny$Measurementscale == ids$Measurementscale &        ny$Season == ids$Season, ]      fit <- glm(Probability ~ Percentile, family = binomial, data = this_raw)   new_pred <- predict(     fit,      newdata = data.frame(Percentile = seq(1, 99, 1)),      type = 'response',     interval = 'prediction'   ) %>% round(4)      pred_df <- data.frame(     grade = ids$Grade,     measurementscale = ids$Measurementscale,     fallwinterspring = ids$Season,     percentile = seq(1, 99, 1),     pass_probability = new_pred,     stringsAsFactors = FALSE   )      all_preds[[i]] <- pred_df }  ny_predicted_pass <- dplyr::rbind_all(all_preds) peek(ny_predicted_pass) save(ny_predicted_pass, file = file.path('data', 'ny_predicted_pass.rda'))

title: report dispatcher
text: common workflow education analysis report progress internal slice organization - academic progress across schools, student growth across classrooms, etc. Stop ’ve heard one : ugh. tedious write, ungainly questions data. want report schools grades? now ’re calling two levels loop… need go deeper one school - say, teacher classroom level? fun stripping code gr writing new loop classrooms.
code: schools <- unique(mydata$schools)  for (sch in schools) {   this_sch <- mydata[mydata$school==sch, ]   grades <- unique(this_sch$grade_level)      for (gr in grades) {          ...do some stuff here   } }

what: what you need to make a plot
title: report dispatcher
text: plot functions mapvizieR really need two things: - mapvizieR object - list studentids run. () time list studentids semantic meaning - class, advisory, grade, school - design principle ’re trying follow give plot mapvizieR object studentids, ’ll get back graphic. ’ll need break assumption time - instance plotting cohort growth, strong assumptions students representing ‘grade levels’. longitudinal plots risk becoming incoherent mix kids different ages together. can return meaningful plot just given list studentids, point departure.

title: report dispatcher
text: report_dispatcher() designed make analyst’s life easier giving high-level language slicing reporting schools. give nested org units (match columns mapvizier[['roster']] data file) iterate , hands back plots permutations org units. let’s walk example. ’s roster object looks like sample data: ’ll dispatch galloping_elephants() plot across district. first define cut_list call_list: cut list nested biggest -> smallest. iterate schools roster, gender inside school. call function school level (element call_list, FALSE) call function gender, schoolwide. hand lists report dispatcher, along name function list additional arguments required function. report_dispatcher returns list, output function call. can see output simply printing list.         blends! let’s change cut_list demonstrate easy show different cut district’s data.

title: report dispatcher
text: ’ll notice throwing somewhat esoteric cuts report_dispatcher far. ’s ? Well, sample data set NWEA kind weird. Namely, ’s one student enrolled Three Sisters Elementary first grade Go figure. given sufficiently large school district, well, ’re going see weird edge cases - either dirty data, just weird one-situations. Report dispatcher wraps every function call try() puts output onto list. returns list, runs post-processing function. Currently function only_valid_plots(), simply drops bad plots object. Errors still printed console, ’ll get back list plots rendered.         Don’t like behavior? Roll post-processor!

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andrew Martin. Author, maintainer. Chris Haid. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Martin , Haid C (2025). mapvizieR: Visualization Data Analysis Tools NWEA MAP Student Data. R package version 0.4.0, https://github.com/almartin82/mapvizieR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {mapvizieR: Visualization and Data Analysis Tools for NWEA MAP Student Data},   author = {Andrew Martin and Chris Haid},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.4.0},   url = {https://github.com/almartin82/mapvizieR}, }

title: mapvizieR
text: mapvizieR provides comprehensive suite visualization analysis tools NWEA MAP assessment data. helps educators analysts explore student growth, achievement, progress intuitive visualizations data transformations.

title: mapvizieR
code: # Install from GitHub (recommended) # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("almartin82/mapvizieR")  # Or use devtools # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("almartin82/mapvizieR")

title: mapvizieR
text: mapvizieR works two primary data inputs NWEA MAP: CDF (Comprehensive Data File): Student-level test results Roster: Student demographic enrollment information
code: library(mapvizieR)  # Read your MAP data files cdf <- read_cdf("path/to/your/cdf_file.csv") roster <- read_roster("path/to/your/roster_file.csv")

title: mapvizieR
code: # Create the main mapvizieR object mapviz <- mapvizieR(   cdf = cdf,   roster = roster,   growth_norms = 2015  # Use 2015 NWEA growth norms )

title: mapvizieR
code: # Summary statistics summary(mapviz)  # Get student growth data growth_df <- mapviz$growth_df  # Filter by specific criteria filtered <- mv_filter(   mapviz,   roster_filter = quote(schoolname == "My School") )

title: mapvizieR
text: mapvizieR includes many visualization functions exploring MAP data:

title: mapvizieR
code: # Becca Plot: Student-level growth visualization becca_plot(   mapvizieR_obj = mapviz,   studentids = students$studentid,   measurementscale = "Mathematics",   start_fws = "Fall",   start_year = 2023,   end_fws = "Spring",   end_year = 2024 )

title: mapvizieR
code: # Galloping Elephants: Distribution over time galloping_elephants(   mapvizieR_obj = mapviz,   studentids = students$studentid,   measurementscale = "Reading",   first_and_spring_only = FALSE )

title: mapvizieR
code: # HAID Plot: Historical achievement and growth haid_plot(   mapvizieR_obj = mapviz,   studentids = students$studentid,   measurementscale = "Mathematics",   start_fws = "Fall",   start_year = 2023,   end_fws = "Spring",   end_year = 2024 )

title: mapvizieR
text: mapvizieR 0.4.0 introduces consistent theming visualizations:
code: library(ggplot2)  # Use the mapvizieR theme ggplot(data, aes(x, y)) +   geom_point() +   theme_mapvizier()  # Quartile color scales ggplot(data, aes(x, y, fill = quartile)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_quartile()  # Get color palettes mapvizier_quartile_colors() mapvizier_growth_colors()

Rather return nothing , say, 12th grade Reading, data frame extends norms previous grade data exists.  imperfect approximation, sure, least directionally accurate.

title: mapvizieR 0.4.0 (2025-12-25)
text: major modernization release updates mapvizieR compatibility current R package ecosystem standards.

title: mapvizieR 0.4.0 (2025-12-25)
text: Minimum R version increased 4.1.0 native pipe support modern features. Removed ensurer dependency - package archived CRAN. validation now uses cli rlang better error messages. ggplot2 >= 3.4.0 required - updated plots use linewidth instead deprecated size parameter line elements. dplyr >= 1.1.0 required - replaced deprecated scoped verbs (summarize_(), group_by_(), etc.) modern equivalents using .data[[var]] syntax.

title: mapvizieR 0.4.0 (2025-12-25)
text: New theme_mapvizier() function - Provides consistent theming across mapvizieR visualizations. Use match package’s visual style. scale_fill_quartile() - Consistent quartile fill colors scale_color_quartile() - Consistent quartile point/line colors scale_fill_growth() - Growth status colors mapvizier_quartile_colors() - Returns quartile color palette mapvizier_growth_colors() - Returns growth status colors mapvizier_kipp_colors() - Returns KIPP-style quartile colors GitHub Actions CI/CD - Package now uses modern GitHub Actions workflows automated testing, coverage reporting, pkgdown documentation. pkgdown documentation site - Full documentation now available https://almartin82.github.io/mapvizieR

title: mapvizieR 0.4.0 (2025-12-25)
text: panel.margin -> panel.spacing size -> linewidth line geoms Removed deprecated environment parameter ggplot() calls summarize_() -> summarize() .data pronoun group_by_() -> group_by() .data pronoun select_() -> select() all_of() tbl_df() -> removed (tibbles work directly) Fixed margin specification using margin() instead deprecated unit() pattern. Improved error messages throughout actionable guidance.

title: mapvizieR 0.4.0 (2025-12-25)
text: Updated README installation instructions quick start guide. exported functions now complete roxygen2 documentation. Added pkgdown site organized reference articles. Updated vignettes use modern syntax.

title: mapvizieR 0.4.0 (2025-12-25)
text: Added testthat 3rd edition support. Added infrastructure vdiffr visual regression tests. Improved test coverage visualization functions.

title: mapvizieR 0.4.0 (2025-12-25)
text: norms = 2011 option deprecated removed future version. Please use norms = 2015 update newer norms available.

title: mapvizieR 0.3.7
text: Minor maintenance release. Fixed calculation end_n_75th_pctl growth_summary. Added rounding improvements. Added new metrics cdf_summary.

title: mapvizieR 0.3.6
text: summary() methods growth_df cdf now respect incoming dplyr groupings. use new janitor package @sfirke clean data frame names.

title: mapvizieR 0.3.5
text: various hotfixes plots breaking. issues appear related upstream changes dplyr. particular: base::rbind() replaced dplyr::bind_rows(). rbind seems confused dplyr output. see issue 293 detail. dplyr::select needed references matches explicitly prefixed dplyr::. Something scoping dplyr::select() statements appears changed dplyr 0.5.0.

title: mapvizieR 0.3.4
